name: Kent Rover (3 days)
description:
KENT ROVER Unlimited travel with weekday time restrictions for 3 consecutive days around Kent. It extends from Swanley and Gravesend in the north to the Kent coastal towns of Ramsgate and Dover and is bounded on the west by the 
      Sevenoaks-Tonbridge-Ashford-Folkestone line plus Tunbridge Wells.

fares_and_restrictions.raw: fares & restrictions New fares from 8th June 2025 3 consecutive days adult: £60.00 child (5-15): £30.00 child (accompanied)*: £5.00 16-17 saver: £30.00 railcards ⯆ 16 26 SE DI 2T FF : £40.00 Railcards ⯈ Railcards: 16 = 16-25 26 = 26-30 SE = Senior DI = Disabled 2T = Two Together FF = Family & Friends *This fare is for accompanied children up to a maximum of four Previous fares ⯈ Previous fares (adult): 2024 - £45.00 2023 - £45.00 2022 - £45.00 2021 - £45.00 2020 - £45.00 2019 - £45.00 2018 - £45.00 2014 - £39.50 2011 - £38.00 time restrictions Mon to Fri: valid from 09:30 No restrictions at weekends or bank holidays route restrictions Not valid between Ashford and Hastings Not valid between Otford and Sevenoakes via Bat & Ball train operating companies Southeastern only purchasing Online: x Train conductor: ✔ * Station ticket office: ✔ Ticket Vending Machine: i Northern Ticket Vending Machines now sell most ranger and rover tickets but at the moment only for same-day travel (rather prohibitive for distant areas) Some Avanti West Coast station TVMs for example Crewe, now sell local rangers and rovers. LNER TVMs at Doncaster, Edinburgh, London Kings Cross, Newcastle and York also sell them. A number of PTE areas sell local rangers from TVMs in their area e.g. South Yorkshire, Strathclyde and West Midlands * valid ticket to travel is required unless boarded at a station without ticket-issuing facilities
